snippet: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. said he welcomed a debate over the legalization of illicit drugs in the United States, then knocked down the arguments in favor of it.
abstract: Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr begins a two-day trip to Mexico and Honduras by delivering a blunt message to Latin American leaders who are contemplating legalization of illicit drugs, saying that the United States will not drop its opposition to legalization.
lead_paragraph: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. said he welcomed a debate over the legalization of illicit drugs in the United States, then knocked down the arguments in favor of it.

headline.seo: U.S. Stands Firm Against Drug Legalization, Biden Says
headline.main: U.S. Remains Opposed to Drug Legalization, Biden Tells Region
headline.print_headline: U.S. Remains Opposed to Drug Legalization, Biden Tells Region
